result.execSummary:
The defendant William J Gonzales was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel.], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Counts one and three.

Defendant William J Gonzales in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant William J Gonzales in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 36 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 155 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court ordered the Defendant to:
-Serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2 with credit for zero days time served.  
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay related surcharge by 7/27/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Restitution set at zero

Sentence to commence FORTHWITH. Defendant remanded.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant William J Gonzales not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is in trial. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 7/27/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant William J Gonzales not in court, in custody.  
Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Sentencing Hearing.  The Court is unable to hear this matter due to the lateness of the hour (4:45 p.m.)  Adjourned date selected with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant William J Gonzales in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant William J Gonzales in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty.  On state's motion the Court orders the "Repeater" penalty enhancer DISMISSED as to all three counts.  The Court ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  

AS TO COUNTS 4 AND 5:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion the Court orders Counts 4 and 5 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 1, 2, and 3.

The Court finds that the state needs to prove-up second and subsequent offense penalty enhancer prior to sentencing.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Case set for Sentencing Hearing on 6-26-15 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 15.

Defendant William J Gonzales not in court, defendant in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Atty Epps is in trial in another court. Case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/25/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant William J Gonzales not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Due to the lateness of the morning, case rescheduled for PLEA and SENTENCING on 6/22/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant William J Gonzales in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 15.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant William J Gonzales not in court, in custody. Marissa Santiago for Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings.   Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Case calendared for STATUS on 4/17/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.

Defendant William J Gonzales in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant William J Gonzales in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William J Gonzales in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant William J Gonzales in custody.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defense moves to dismiss either Count 2 or 4 as Duplicitous and dismiss Count 3 for lack of probable cause.  Arguments heard.  Court DENIES motion on all three counts.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 3 & 5 preserving Defendant's right of substitution.  Court orders Criminal Complaint amended as to the penalty portion of Count 4 to read:  By not more than 4 years, if the prior conviction was a felony.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
